content:
Does emacs' lean-mode have anything like vs code's light bulb feature, which I read about section 6.1 of *Mathematics in Lean*? Here's the quote:

In the first two examples, the fields of the structure are named explicitly. In the first case, because Lean knows that the expected type of my_point1 is a point, you can start the definition by writing an underscore, _. Clicking on the light bulb that appears nearby in VS Code will then give you the option of inserting a template definition with the field names listed for you.
I think the lean(3)-mode in emacs does have support for hole commands. If you have helm or something similar, I would search for the command with M-x lean hole and it should come up in the list.
Quinn Culver has marked this topic as resolved.
